citation.article-title: Thermocrinis ruber gen. nov., sp. nov., A pink-filament-forming hyperthermophilic bacterium isolated from yellowstone national park

p.s: Description of the Thermocrinis gen. nov.
Thermocrinis (Ther.mo.cri'nis. Gr. fem. n. therme, heat; L. masc. n. crinis, hair; M.L. n. Thermocrinis, hot hair)
Cells are gram-negative rods that occur singly, in pairs, and in aggregates.
Long filaments are formed in a permanent flow of medium.
Pure cultures can be obtained by selected cell cultivation.
Growth occurs at temperatures up to 89Â°C and at salinities up to 0.4% NaCl.
The DNA base composition is about 47.5 mol% G+C.
As determined by 16S rRNA analysis, the genus Thermocrinis is a new genus belonging to the order Aquificales.
The type species is Thermocrinis ruber.
